CatDescriptText: Stephen Powell, unemployed, 1868 Linton Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the steel strike will be resumed after the 80-day 'cooling-off' period imposed by the Supreme Court under the injection of the Taft-Hartley Act?" answer reads: "Yes, if they don't have a contract it is only right that they resume the strike... It is better to control the cost of living, but since this is not being done, then the steelworkers are justified in seeking a higher wage."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Stephen Powell wearing fedora, diagonally striped tie, and dark overcoat, standing in front of painted brick building with sign reading "...shined...dyed..."
